results.title: New Orleans mardi gras
results.brief_description:
Some say the happiest day in New Orleans is Shrove Tuesday. And it is a day that stands for the entire carnival season with its Mardi Gras carnival parade. In this film the theme of the procession is “Toys” and every float is a variation on that theme. the people of the Algiers stage their parade on the broad waters of the Mississippi.
Completely planned, financed and executed with thirty or more secret organisations - a great deal of the activities are directed by tradition.

results.title: You and I, Horizontal II
results.material_description: computer, computer script, projector and  haze machine
results.brief_description:
Step into a dark haze-filled room to interact with the power of projected light. Transforming a beam of light into a three-dimensional sculpture, Anthony McCall’s ‘You and I, Horizontal II’ (2006) is an Australian premiere.

The pioneering work of British-born artist Anthony McCall occupies a space between sculpture, cinema, performance and drawing. McCall was one of the first visual artists to experiment with spatial film and temporal sculpture, emerging in the mid 1970s with the ‘Solid Light’ film series - works that used a 16mm projector to project cones of light through smoke or haze filled rooms. His work attracted renewed attention in the 1990s, when spatial installations once again became a popular and critical tendency in contemporary art. He now uses digital projection and complex graphic software systems to capture the most basic sensory element of the moving image: the projection of light.

results.title: ACMI in the regions: Stories from South Gippsland
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Roberto Salvatore, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Twelve stories, set in three different towns situated in the South Gippsland region. Comprises of interviews and stories about the townspeople of Meeniyan, Bena, Loch, Poowong, Nyora, Mirboo North and Mount Best. It looks at their past, daily lives and the things that bind these small communities together.

results.title: Geelong TCUFA : weaving and winding : more than a job : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: Five employees of carpet manufacturer Brintons and Textile Clothing and Footwear Union tell about their lives before, during and after working at Brintons. The factory closed in June 2008, leaving 100 people without jobs.

results.title: ACMI in the regions: Stories from Lockington
results.brief_description: Interviews with residents, groups and business owners of Lockington, Shire of Campaspe. These five short documentaries look at life in Lockington from different perspectives, covering local businesses, the Lockington Living Heritage Complex, a young girl growing up in Lockington, the experiences of a group of women and the Lockington Hotel, where the locals come to meet and enjoy local music at night.

results.title: ACMI in the regions: Stories from Campaspe
results.creator_credit: Richard Greenhalgh, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Nine stories about residents from around the Campaspe region in northern Victoria. Covering the towns of Nanneella, Gunbower and Colbinabbin, locals tell stories about their lives and their connection to the land and the community.

results.title: The Milky way = Dairy farming in Maffra
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: This film showcases farming in the Maffra region and features six farmers who are leading the way in innovation and new farming technologies. Alan Clyne and his son Allister together with Robert White and John White are involved in the Herd Improvement initiative. Graeme Anderson and his son Ross are making the most of new irrigation techniques. Max Warren introduces his Robotic Dairy, the first ever to be used in Australia.

results.title: Welcome to Maffra
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: This film starts with Darren McCubbin, the Mayor of the Wellington Shire, welcoming the audience to Maffra. Darren explains that we are about to visit some of the places and meet some of the people that make Maffra a unique place to live. The film features the Geoff Webster Centre, the Gippsland Vehicle Collection, the Maffra Gymnastics Club, the George Gray Centre, Wallaby Rise Restaurant, Cambrai Backpacker Hostel and Jenny McDavitt an Alpaca farmer and Ferial Zikerman who is now internationally known for her Maffra Cheese.
